tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE WaterUsageData (
  meter_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location_id INT,
  reading_date DATE,
  water_usage DECIMAL,
  efficiency DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE water_efficiency_analysis (
  analysis_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  meter_id INT,
  efficiency_rating FLOAT,
  analysis_date DATE,
  FOREIGN KEY (meter_id) REFERENCES smart_water_meters(meter_id)
);

CREATE TABLE WaterMeters (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id INT,
    location VARCHAR,
    customer_id INT,
    water_consumed DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE MeterData (
    meter_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    water_flow_rate DECIMAL,
    pressure DECIMAL,
    temperature DECIMAL,
    PRIMARY KEY (meter_id, timestamp)
);

CREATE TABLE CustomerInfo (
    customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR,
    address VARCHAR,
    email VARCHAR,
    phone VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE users ( 
    user_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, 
    username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, 
    email VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, 
    address VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL 
)

CREATE TABLE smart_meters ( 
    meter_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, 
    meter_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, 
    installation_date DATE NOT NULL, 
    location VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL 
)

CREATE TABLE water_readings ( 
    reading_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, 
    meter_id INTEGER NOT NULL, 
    reading_date DATE NOT NULL, 
    reading_value DECIMAL(8,2) NOT NULL 
)

CREATE TABLE usage_statistics ( 
    statistic_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, 
    meter_id INTEGER NOT NULL, 
    usage_date DATE NOT NULL, 
    efficiency DECIMAL(5,2) NOT NULL 
)

CREATE TABLE alerts ( 
    alert_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, 
    meter_id INTEGER NOT NULL, 
    alert_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, 
    alert_date TIMESTAMP NOT NULL 
)
